title: Efficient Transformer Variants for Edge Deployment
bit: Transformer models are too large and slow for edge devices
flip: Develop compressed transformer variants using knowledge distillation and quantization
hypothesis: A 10x smaller transformer can maintain 95% of performance through careful distillation and 8-bit quantization
evaluationPlan:
1. Baseline: Measure BERT-base performance on GLUE benchmark
2. Apply knowledge distillation with temperature scaling
3. Implement 8-bit quantization with QAT
4. Measure: model size, inference latency, GLUE scores
5. Statistical tests: paired t-tests on each GLUE task
expectedOutcomes:
- Model size: 440MB → 44MB
- Inference time: 50ms → 5ms
- GLUE score: 82.5 → 78.4 (95% retention)
risksAndMitigation:
Risk: Catastrophic performance drop on specific tasks
Mitigation: Task-specific fine-tuning after compression
timeline: 4 weeks: 1 week setup, 2 weeks experiments, 1 week analysis

title: ML-Guided Parameter-to-Structure Mapping for Iron Oxide Nanoparticles
bit: Nanoparticle synthesis requires extensive empirical knowledge and trial-and-error optimization
flip: Machine learning can systematically map synthesis parameters to nanostructure properties, enabling predictive design
hypothesis: ML models can predict iron oxide nanostructure morphology, size, and phase from synthesis parameters with >85% accuracy
evaluationPlan:
1. Collect dataset: 500 hydrothermal syntheses with varied parameters
2. Characterize via XRD, SEM, TEM for phase, morphology, size
3. Train ensemble models (RF, XGBoost, NN) on parameter→structure mapping
4. Validate with 20% hold-out set and cross-validation
5. Statistical analysis: accuracy metrics, feature importance, generalization
expectedOutcomes:
- Phase prediction accuracy: 88±5%
- Size prediction RMSE: 12±3 nm
- Morphology classification: 83±4% accuracy
risksAndMitigation:
Risk: Overfitting to limited parameter space
Mitigation: K-fold cross-validation, active learning, multiple characterization techniques
timeline: 8 weeks: 3 weeks data collection, 3 weeks ML development, 2 weeks analysis

title: Autonomous Synthesis with Real-time Feedback Control
bit: Human expertise is required for materials synthesis optimization
flip: Autonomous systems can synthesize target materials without prior human knowledge using real-time feedback
hypothesis: An autonomous system can synthesize target iron oxide nanostructures in <50 iterations with 90% success rate
evaluationPlan:
1. Design closed-loop platform: microfluidic + in-situ characterization + ML control
2. Implement Bayesian optimization with GP surrogate models
3. Compare autonomous vs human expert performance
4. Test across 10 target specifications
5. Analyze iteration count, success rate, resource efficiency
expectedOutcomes:
- Average iterations to target: 38±12
- Success rate: 93±5%
- Resource efficiency improvement: 35±8%
risksAndMitigation:
Risk: System calibration drift, target selection bias
Mitigation: Regular recalibration, randomized targets, multiple experts baseline
timeline: 8 weeks: 3 weeks platform development, 3 weeks campaigns, 2 weeks analysis

title: Multi-objective Optimization for Functional Properties
bit: Surface effects in nanoparticles are unavoidable byproducts that limit performance
flip: Surface state engineering can be systematically controlled to enhance nanoparticle properties
hypothesis: ML-guided surface engineering can simultaneously optimize magnetic saturation (>60 emu/g) and colloidal stability (>6 months)
evaluationPlan:
1. Design multi-objective optimization framework
2. Parameter space: core synthesis + surface modification
3. Implement Pareto-efficient optimization using NSGA-II
4. 200 synthesis conditions with high-throughput characterization
5. Compare against single-objective baselines and literature
expectedOutcomes:
- Pareto front with >15 non-dominated solutions
- Best performers: Ms = 65±3 emu/g, stability = 8±2 months
- Surface parameter importance: 0.45±0.08
risksAndMitigation:
Risk: Multi-collinearity, local optima, measurement precision
Mitigation: Feature selection, multiple runs, replicated measurements
timeline: 8 weeks: 3 weeks synthesis, 3 weeks optimization, 2 weeks analysis
